meanings.definition: To be equal or similar to something else in terms of value or quality.
meanings.sent1: The taste of the homemade pie paralleled that of the bakery pie.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication to her work paralleled her commitment to her family.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the two teams paralleled a friendly race.
meanings.sent4: The growth of the small plant paralleled the rise of a skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the two paintings paralleled each other perfectly.

meanings.definition: To occur at the same time or in a similar way.
meanings.sent1: The thunder paralleled the lightning in the storm.
meanings.sent2: His actions paralleled his words during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The dance moves of the two dancers paralleled a synchronized routine.
meanings.sent4: The rise and fall of the waves paralleled the beating of a heart.
meanings.sent5: The chirping of the birds paralleled the rustling of the leaves.

meanings.definition: To create a parallel line or structure.
meanings.sent1: She carefully paralleled the edges of the paper to create a border.
meanings.sent2: The architect paralleled the walls to form a hallway.
meanings.sent3: The rows of trees paralleled a straight path in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The train tracks paralleled the highway for miles.
meanings.sent5: The stitches on the fabric paralleled each other perfectly.
